moves.1. c4:
Computer analysis of this game is available at http://gameknot.com/analyze-board.pl?bd=18564045&rnd=0.21791306044906378

This game was an open challenge as part of my attempts to get my rating back above 1500, as it turned out it was one of the shorter games I have played for a while in that it was all over in twenty moves.

The game starts with my favoured english opening
moves.1... e5 2. Nc3 Nf6 3. Nf3: Bellon Gambit which I don't have much experience of so I thought I would give it a try
moves.3... Nc6 4. a3: This is an unusual move for me but I wanted to reduce the risk of doubled pawns on c
moves.4... d5 5. cxd5 Nxd5 6. e4: Qc2 is another option here but I was happy to have the chance to bring my b pawn to c
moves.6... Nxc3 7. bxc3 b6: This takes us out of the Gameknot database which favours developing one or other bishop. The computer calls this a mistake preferring Bc5
moves.8. Bb5: While this pin can easily be broken I think its irritating for black.
moves.8... Bb7 9. d4: The computer prefers Qa4 here. I like the threat of d5.
moves.9... f6 10. O-O Bd6 11. d5: last chance to play it before the knight can escape
moves.11... O-O 12. dxc6 Bc8 13. Nh4 a6 14. Bc: threatens Qxc6 which I am happy with due to Bd5 skewering the rook
moves.16. Qd1 Qxc6: At this point I realised that if I could get the black queen away from the a4-e8 diagonal he would be in trouble due to the threat of Qh6
moves.17. Bd5 Qxc3:
he takes the bait, the computer now claims mate in 8

… Qxc3 18. Qh5 Rf7 19. Qxf7 Be6 20. Bxe6 Qxc1 21. Rfxc1 Rf8 22. Ng6+ hxg6 23. Qxg6 Rf7 24. Bxf7 Bxa3 25. Qh5#
